rComments: he is one of the best Professor in this horrid school. He is sweet, caring, and actually funny sometimes. I took many sociology courses mainly because of him. SISTERS!!! If he is teaching any 300 level course, PLEASE TAKE IT or YOU WILL REGRET IT.

Professor Berry is the one of the best professors at U of T. He is very smart, explains the material very well, and his lectures are well organized and to the point. He provides exceptionally qualitative feedback and cares deeply about his students.

I enjoyed the material and prof Berry provides a good intro to demography with lots of interesting insights from current events and historical examples. two tests and a final paper are the grade components. You can choose a topic you like, but I recommend visiting Berry in office hours for help in narrowing it down.
loved Berry's lectures. He covers a broad scope of population topics. Tests are multiple choice and short anser questions. 10-15 page paper due at the end of the term.

He's a pretty nice guy and the class itself is not difficult. he regurgitates the textbook so if you miss a class its nbd. BUT, his length of time that he uses to grade is ridiculous. the class is over, exam written and all, and i only have 30% of my grade now. i handed in a paper 6 weeks ago that i still dont have it back. totally unnaccpetable.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: nice prof.  some of the journa articles are challenging to read since there is no textbook.  paper assignment allows a broad choice of topics.
really interesting course.  some of the lectures have too many slides, and it is hard to keep up.
He is very knowledgeable but some lectures I found to be dull. Also I found his multiple choice to be tricky.

one of my favorite professors from my time at U of T.  Berry adds lots of interesting examples to the theory, and stays after class to talk to students and answer questions.  Some of his presentations contain too many slides, making it hard to keep up.

The course was very interesting and I think a big part was Prof. Berry and his lecturing ability. Is extremely knowledgable of the material, and I disagree with some of the other comments that he reads from the slides; he often elaborates a lot and perhaps his teaching style has since changed (took it in 2016 spring semester). Very enjoyable course

Enjoyed this intro to urban sociology, and Berry brings a focus on certain topics such as housing, segregation, ethnicity, and the political economy of Toronto.  He is very interested in urban planning and the built form, and brought a lot of insights and examples from Toronto into his lectures.   There is an exercise, two tests, and paper.
Lectures are very boring and not clear. Not helpful at all and does not reply to emails. Hard marker, disorganized and bell curves the grade. Would not re-take this course with him.

Hated this class. It wasn't a difficult course, but its lack of organization and clarity made it incredibly stressful. Would definitely not recommend. If you're interested in the material, you're probably better off learning it yourself.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'So many papers', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: I had a terrible experience in this course which turned me off from pursuing SOC. If you take SOC205, check the hard copies of your tests against the answer key and make sure that you meet with him during the planning and drafting stages of your paper to ensure that you are interpreting his (very loose)criteria clearly. First university B. Livid.

He is very approachable and cares a lot about students. Especially for the course paper he was always there to help. however, the material can get a bit dry and boring. it is an easy course if you read the readings.

Professor Berry's course is interesting for its multi level focus on health, thinking broadly about health (not just physical and mental, but social and cultural), and relating it to urbanization.  His lectures are interesting and he cares about students..he makes use of text and video here and there to enhance the material. grades- tests and paper
Absolutley one of the worst professors I've ever had. Class is so disorganized, boring, and tests are worded horribly. Would never take this class or recommend it to anyone.

Berry is a complete disappointment. Urban Health sounded like an amazing class to take but he simply does not deliver. Lectures are boring, hardly relevant to health at all, and the sentences written on his powerpoint are vague and uninformative. His slides also include many useless graphs. The TA however is incredible and should teach the class.

Prof Berry is very approachable. He marks very leniently and is willing to help students. Topics are interesting, and the workload is okay. Not a difficult course as long as you do the readings and spend some time on the paper.

Good prof. Great course if you're into urban issues. Tests are MC & SA. Some questions are tricky, but most are intuitive. Questions based more on lectures & slides than text. He makes an effort to incorporate videos and TEDtalks in lecture. Gave us entire year to work on essay and graded us generously.

Straight forward and clear. I don't think anyone could've done a better job teaching stats than this guy. I just feel bad that more people didn't attend class; he tries so hard to explain things to you and half of the people don't even attend. Overall a nice guy, great lecturer and very competent. Stats is boring, but you'll be in good hands.

Brent is very encouraging and communicates the course material quite effectively.  Statistics is rather a dry subject, though highly utilitarian, so it is a difficult task to effectively convey this knowledge to students.  Given this, Brent surpassed my expectations in every respect.
Okay. TA marks 10-page essay. Tests are MC and SA.

So boring!!!! Extremely lazy Prof., he makes no attempts to make the class interesting. I am so upset that I spent so much money to watch him stand in front of the room and read off the lecture slides. Isn't this U of T, are we not supposed to have the best Professors? I hope that Professor Berry is not the best that U of T has to offer.
This man is God.
He's very clear about the material and there really isn't much any person can do to make statistics interesting! I find him very helpful and he takes his job seriously. He's also very good-looking!

Brent Berry is very fair, approachable, and organized. He is appreciative of students engaging in the class and is never condensending. If you read the material, attend classes, and go for extra help with papers, you will ace the class

I think he's fun and interesting, he's strangely obsessed with the city of Toronto (his screensaver is the Toronto skyline, I thought it was cute). Somewhat disorganized but I think it's more nerves than anything. You can tell he's really passionate about what he is teaching...and I think he's cute!
Really nice, approachable, kind of funny.  Lectures are a bit dry, he at least tries to involve people though.  solid prof overall
Is a good professor.  Makes dry material interesting.
Super disorganized thought process and lecture style. Constatly going on tangents and talks circles around questions. Generally not very iunteresting way of organizing material.
Best prof ever! knows his stuff
No Comments
Boring...Very Boring. But he marks very leniently and he's very approachable
